Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah e
Reviews.Content: Good family room, nice staff and great breakfasts on the roof terrace. Don't eat at the Chinese restaurant round the corner opposite the local shop - hideous food and they add loads to the bill!

Reviews.Title: “More of a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: YasminMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location, right behind the Blue Mosque. But it is more of a hostel than a hotel. The showers are stalls designed for one thin person. The rooms are also very small and the walls are paper thin, you can hear everything. But the Turkoman does have a beautiful terrace where you have amazing views and they have a superb staff. So if you can bear the thin walls, small rooms and a shower stall, then it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ozilynx Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: Last September, we spent some days at this beautiful hotel. It's basically just in front of the Blue Mosque. We could see it from our room. The room was clean, not too much big, but when you have so many things so close to see, you need it just for sleeping. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast is at the rooftop: we got fresh fruits, yoghurt, Turkish pastry and tea every morning with a wonderful view (look at the hotel website and you can have an idea of it!). Free wifi is available, you can ask the password at the desk. I really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Check out the views from the terrace!”
Reviews.Author: EryelP
Reviews.Content: I just tried the terrace: nice tea which came with small sesame muffin and Turkish pastry. Fantastic views over the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, charming, good value”
Reviews.Author: travelwriter83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Turkoman for 3 nights on a November stopover in Istanbul on our way to Chicago and we were very happy with this choice in Sultanahmet. It was a great value for the price, right next to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Underground Cistern, and the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Art. Topkapi Palace, the Archeological Museum, the Grand Bazaar, and the Spice Bazaar are all within a walking distance of 10 - 12 minutes, or a tram ride of 5 minutes or less. Taksim is a longer tram ride, but easy to navigate to. The hotel itself was very charming - nicely renovated and furnished with antiques in a very cozy, tasteful way. No elevator, but the bellhop took up the bags and there are only 3 floors with easy stairs. Clean rooms, beds were comfortable, the heat worked well, water pressure was fantastic. The breakfast room which doubles as a daytime/evening cafe with a terrace is lovely, with a beautiful view over the Blue Mosque and red rooftops heading out toward the sea. Free internet and good, basic breakfast with eggs and some Turkish items (cheese, olives, sweets, etc.). Staff was friendly. For someone staying longer, there was a good selection of books and games on the shelves and dvds in the room, making the place feel quite like a home away from home. Highly recommended, we'd definitely stay here again on a longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Turkoman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KuimiriaA
Reviews.Content: A small boutique hotel, family owned and operated. The hotel has basic facilities and the rooms are small but it is clean and well presented for a reasonable cost starting at 65 euros a night. The staff (family) are friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is a few steps away from the Hippodrome, The Blue Mosque, Hagi Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. There is a continental, antipasta style and a hot selection for breakfast. Our other meals we had whilst out exploring but found that the Optimist Cafe 20 metres away from the Hotel provided good food from a reasonable menu selection. We can recommend their casseroles and coffee. We booked all our tours through the hotel and were picked up at the door. The tram system is only about 150m away from the hotel and this will take you just about anywhere in Istanbul including the the airport. The other patrons of the hotel came from all parts of the world and were only too willing to share their experiences. We would particularly like to thank the two ladies from South Africa who shared their ten years of Turkish experiences with us and we had such a fantastic week that we will be ging back to explore more of this beautiful country.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Turkoman!”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Anne M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a pretty, clean and very functional yellow room. Lots of hot water and great water pressure. Great breakfast in the rooftop terrace that has a view of the Blue Mosque! Clean, reasonably priced and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Centrally located and walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Spice Market. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly and relaxed, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: chrisGOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights as a family of four (2 adults two teenagers). It would be hard to find a more centrally located hotel in the Sultanahmet region - one of the best museumes is literally three metres away on the other side of the road. Very close to Topkapi, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Hippodrome. Despite this it is very quiet indeed - tucked down a side street. The hotel itself feels more like a 'pension' than a big hotel - it is like living in a house. The best thing is the roof terrace which has the most fantastic views across the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. It is not 'posh' - the breakfast area has a feel of the 1950s about it - but we liked that. You eat brekast up here and they were really good about us coming up and down from our room carrying cups of coffee and juice - all very relaxed. Very nice breakfasts. After you have done your sightseeing you can come back for a cold beer on the terrace before you head out for dinner. The rooms are not large but this is because it is an old builidng in a very central location. Very good A/C. The staff are very friendly and helpful - they went beyond the call of durty on the last day when we were delivered with a hire car with no petrol in it. The son of one of the ladies who works there came with us and he drove with us to find a petrol station (nightmare traffic in central Istanbul!!) then drove with us to the port to catch the ferry across the Marmaris sea. We dropped him off and he found his own way back. I would definitely go to the Turkoman again next time I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “quite intimate city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena B
Reviews.Content: The perfect location of this family run hotel In Sultanahmet makes for a wondefull stay in Istanbul. It is about 300meters from the Sultanahmet tram station and you look out over the Blue Mosque when you have breakfast. Most friendly and helpfull staff and Rifat at reception is most knowledgeable of all things Turkish - wether you are looking for directions to museums or shops to visit. The rooms/bathrooms are exceptionally spacious and very clean and tastefully furnished. Will certainly stay at the Turkoman again this year as our 11 days there in Nov 2010 was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great location. Brilliant terrace restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: EBuygum
Reviews.Content: Nice room, clean but not spacious. The terrace is a lovely place for a leisurely breakfast and for a couple of beers before going out for dinner. Great location and helpful staff. There's a car park opposite (not owned by hotel) which is supervised 24 hours; I left my bike there no problem. Wouldn't really think of staying anywhere else when I return.

Reviews.Title: “They are more than Staff ... I found Family”
Reviews.Author: mohamed_shehab
Reviews.Content: Starting with the first day ... i asked for a discount for a Triple room and i got it ..... the room was good except that the floor needed some maintenance ..... rooms are called with flower names ... "Afyon" was the name of my room ...... bathroom was great .... sleeping was great ...actually i moved to Turkoman Hotel from Faros Hotel nearby ... where it was so noisy being on the main road .... the location is great few meters from the railway and the blue mosque ...... I stayed there 5 days .... the staff in the kitchen are technically a family ..... they will make their best to make u feel like u r at home ..... the chef is a very nice woman she reminded me of my mother ..... In the last day i got sick ..... i'll never forget this lady making special lemonade for me and the way they showed support to me ..... and the day we checked out the staff said goodbye like we were part of the family .... Don't think about it .... Turkoman Hotel is the best budget hotel in Istanbul ........ The manager of the hotel is a very helpful man and wifi is available ...... THANKS STAFF OF TURKOMAN HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to Turkoman -- a haven in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Madonnadelparto
Reviews.Content: I just returned to the Turkoman hotel for my second visit. This time I was travelling with a workmate, and we both had to mix work and leisure. The good news (if you DO have to work while in Istanbul) is that Turkoman now has free wi-fi in the rooms. If you prefer, you can work upstairs in the terrace cafe, with a cup of Turkish coffee (this comes with turkish delight and sugared almonds), and a perfect view of the blue mosque. Once again, my room was good value and the service was every bit as good as last time: friendly and welcoming, with advice on local sights, etc. The orange marmalade was actually better than I remembered! And the location is excellent -- a two minute walk to the blue mosque, 10 mins to the grand bazaar and the Cemberlitas hammam. Because it is on a side street at the peaceful end of Sultanahmet, it is much quieter than staying over in Beyoglu. The early morning call to prayer flowing out of the blue mosque does wake you up, but only adds to the experience, as it is such a beautiful sound.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place To Stay In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: delvale
Reviews.Content: Right behind the Blue Mosque. Clean, quite, very helpful staff, great location. We had stayed in the Beyoglu section and it was noisey til 5am everyday, so we were so glad to get to the Turkoman which was an Eduardian style building with large rooms, smaller bathrooms, but very clean and super comfortable. The staff was so helpful with everything and the breakfasts were more than the traditional cheese and olives. The hotel is one block away from the tram and tons of restaurants. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, lovely staff, GREAT towels, and a good selection for breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Robin921
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Turkoman for 2 weeks over the Christmas Holidays. The location is ideal for all of the sites, and a breathtaking view of the Blue Mosque from our room. The hotel is spotless, and the service staff are extremely helpful. I was ill one day, and without asking, the staff brought a tray of the perfect food to my room. In chatting with the Manager in the morning, she gave us the perfect tips on Istanbul based on our interests. Overall, it is a comfortable, simple family run hotel that we would be more than happy to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a let down and disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bububazooka
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Turkoman Hotel twice in 2009, I was quick to make a reservation for my return to Istanbul with a friend in August 2010. I was over the moon when I got my confirmation in writing that we had reserved a room overlooking the blue mosque with twin beds and as our holiday drew nearer began to relish the thought of our pre-dinner drink on the terrace listening to the call to prayer above the hub-bub of street level. What a disappointment when we arrived at the hotel. Rifat recognised us from our visit the previous year and we took a seat in reception whilst he retrieved his paperwork regarding our booking. The scene around us was reminiscent of Fawlty Towers with staff taking bedding and towels at speed and scurrying downstairs. After about 15 mins Rifat told us he didn't have a room with twin beds but he had one double room. We were shown to a tiny dark room in the basement of the hotel below reception which clearly had been made up as an emergency when we arrived and couldn't be described as a hotel room. Not only that it had a small double bed. We were two ladies travelling together - why would the hotel think it was appropriate that we should want to pay to share a small double bed when my reservation had clearly stated we were reserving a room with twin beds. What was even more disappointing was the way this was handled. When we asked what had happened to our reservation and produced a copy of the email from Rifat confirming the booking we had made 2 months previously, he merely stated they had a large group in who had taken all the rooms. Clearly a reservation isn't worth the paper it is written on if a bigger group materialises, even though I had provided my credit card details to secure the booking. Additionally Rifat didn't offer to help to find any alternative for us. After we asked him to help us he rang the Alzer Hotel next door who were able to offer us a twin room at the same price as our reservation. No view from the room or roof terrace bar, but they had great service and it was a clean well equipped room. By means of an apology, The Turkoman merely offered that we could have a breakfast in their hotel......not something we chose to take up as we had breakfast included from the Alzer Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round - couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: NMS77
Reviews.Content: The Turkoman is the ideal place to stay in Istanbul, especially if you are visiting the historic sites. The location is brilliant - right opposite the Blue Mosque, but slightly back from the main street so you don't get much noise. Inside, the hotel itself is a tasteful and sensitive renovation of an historic Ottoman building. The balance here is just right - the furnishings and rooms give you a sense of being in wrapped in Istanbul's unique history, but everything is sparklingly clean and you have all the modcons and luxuries you might want. Also, it doesn't get much better than breakfast or sunset drinks on the roof terrace - the view is fabulous. And finally, the staff are extremely friendly and can help with pretty much anything. To be honest, I think this is a brilliant little hotel. I'm a regular visitor to Istanbul because of work, and both I and most of my colleagues will stay here when we can. For myself, I've stayed in the Turkoman in 2010, 2009, and 2007, and will be going back there again later this year. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: LondonNefertiti
Reviews.Content: Central locationwhich is convenient for the all the main sights and the trams. Good choice of fresh foods for the breakfast which you take on to the balcony to eat whilst feasting your eyes on the amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: bububazooka
Reviews.Content: Hotel Turkoman is a hidden gem. It is in the best location overlooking the blue mosque with views of the Sea of Marmaris from the wonderful roof terrace. The friendly staff are so helpful. We stayed twice during our trip to Turkey last year and I'm looking forward to returning this year as we pass through Istanbul. It will be the perfect start to our holiday with a home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta3452
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 days during my first trip to Istanbul 2006. It's a small hotel, so I got quite friendly with the staff. The best part of this hotel is the breakfast room on the roof, looking right out at the Blue Mosque. As a solo traveler, I met the nicest people in the breakfast room. The rooms are simple, but adequate. I returned here in 2008. The location is great if you want to be in Sultanamet. It's away from the carpet dealers! Easy walking distance to bazaar - and if you like to walk, you can walk to Galata Bridge. It's very close to the tram, so you can even take it to the airport. This place is not luxurious, rather it is quaint. If you want simple accommodations in the old city, quiet and chance to talk with college graduates who tend to be the night clerks- you'll enjoy this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Old City”
Reviews.Author: kaapie62
Reviews.Content: We changed our booking to the Turkoman Hotel at the last minute. They offered a free shuttle from the airport - this was waiting for us and was a huge plus after a long flight from Cape Town. The staff at the hotel are very friendly, there is always somebody at the front desk if you have any questions, English was not a problem. The major plus at this hotel is it's location. It's within walking distance of all the sights yet is in a very quiet road. The calls to mosque did wake us up the first night but one gets used to this! All the mosques echo each other - this was a new experience. Breakfast is served on a roof top terrace with the Blue Mosque in sight. The food did not vary at all on the days we were there but it was sufficient. Eggs, other than scrambled, were extra cost. Free Wi-Fi is available in the restaurant/coffee shop which was open until late. A warming cup of tea/coffee after our long daily walks was welcoming, but not free. Tea/Coffee facilities in the room would have been appreciated. The room was adequate at 3* level and clean. Shower only - I loved the smell of the soap - spicy! Bottled water is required even to brush teeth but this is widely available at .50 TL a bottle. Most things can be paid in Turkish Lira, Euro, GPB or USD. We had no complaints, were comfortable, felt welcome, loved the peace and quiet after a day walking the very noisy streets of Istanbul. The Turks love to hoot - at everything and nothing so it's a constant noise! One tip - Istanbul needs to be walked! We always felt safe even if the Turks can be very pushy when selling their wares. Just walk on after a polite "No Thanks" We have no hesitation in recommending this 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff”
Reviews.Author: ingapirca
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Istanbul last eastern. Turkoman Hotel its a small family oriented hotel. The staff is great, very helpful. The location its second to none. Consider to be in the patio of the Blue Mosque/Hagia Sophia/Cistern. From there the rest of the principal attractions in Istanbul are so close (do not need a taxi nor a bus). I really recommend Turkoman Hotel to families. The only thing is that there is no elevator, something to consider if you have knee problems. The other thing is if you are allergic to cats (don't go to Istanbul, because they are everywhere!!, including in Turkoman). The breakfast is excellent!. They do have wi-fi, but if you need a computer, the staff will allow you to use theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel with the best staff”
Reviews.Author: monkeyWaikanae
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at this hotel. We stayed there on and off over a week with trips to other places and back. Each time we returned we were made very welcome and we felt it was 'a home away from home'. The staff were great - full of fun and humour and very obliging. Breakfasts are wonderful - lovely fruit , zuccini fritters and cheese pastries amongst our favourites - all partaken in a lovely terrace room overlooking the Blue Mosque. We would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: KenyaKitten
Reviews.Content: Istanbul rates as one of the coolest cities I have been to. Fantastic romantic place to stay with incredible views of Blue Mosque. Great Breakfasts and they gave us incredible restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “fascinating city, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TyneAndWearLovebirds
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is an endlessly exciting and invigorating city. Much of our pleasure came from long walks. Particularly good was the walk along the city walls, finishing up by the Museum of St. Saviour in Chora to see the splendid Byzantine Mosaics. Also reccomend a cruise up the river, but check around for prices. Another little highlight was the cafe at the Archeological Museum; not particularly for the food, but for the splendid setting of ruins that didn't quite make it inside; it somehow demonstrated the wealth of riches in the city that such lovely pieces could be knocking around the cafe garden. The hotel Turkoman itself was lovely, with a certain faded glamour. A great location, and our room had a view of the Blue Mosque. Everything was very clean and worked well. The resteraunt terrace was great for breakfast, with beautiful views. Just watch out for the seagulls who are expert at thieving unattended food.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel with friendly staff & view on blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: kwijn1
Reviews.Content: as in title, great value hotel, clean, nice rooms, great terras for breakfast both in and outside with romantic view on the blue mosque! Walking distance from all touristic venues!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - if your reservation is honoured”
Reviews.Author: Sandpiper52
Reviews.Content: I had booked for three nights, I turned up in the early evening, exactly as I had advised, only to be told that they were overbooked for the first two nights. There was a suggestion from one staff member that an existing guest had decided to extend his/her stay. Well, this always creates an unfavourable impression. I was refered to a nearby guest-house. It was extremely plain - basic would be the word - but in the same convenient location and substantially cheaper. I did stay at Turkoman on the third night. The location is very convenient , easy walking distance for Istanbul's most famous sights. There really is a stunning view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop dining room, and the breakfast is very good. My room was comfortable, and the hotel as a whole is nicely decorated with carpets, prints and other items. I would have graded it higher had it not been for the over-booking.

Reviews.Title: “The accomodation, the service... wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: classytea
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in and our luggage was carried to our room the service was faultless. The room was clean, light and comfortable with a great view of the Blue Mosque and the sea of Marmara and on a hot Istanbul day the air-conditioning was wonderful! Located a stones throw from the Hippodrome and Museum of Islamic Art and 10 minutes stroll from the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace... you can't beat the location. The best thing was the view from the roof terrace at breakfast, the thing I liked least was my inability to pronounce my room name! All are named after parts of Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: adventurerLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Quite a charming place,with lovely,helpful and efficient staff. However we paid a premium for our room 4A,which was nothing special. The price reflects the location - a stone's throw from just about every major sight you want to see, and this room has views over the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. We did get 10% off the price of the room as we paid cash, and they did throw in a free transfer from the airport as we were staying for 5 nights. I think other rooms are probably cheaper,so it's worth doing some researc h.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit”
Reviews.Author: Kathy58
Reviews.Content: I revisited the Hotel Turkoman with a friend and was not disappointed. The staff remembered me, they were attentive, room was lovely and clean over looking the Blue Mosque and they still had the orange and apricot marmalade at breakfast - yumm!! They gave us some good advice for bargining in the Grand Bazaar. Everything is within walking distance - you cannot fault it. The hotel is an older building that has been tasefully converted - hence no lift but the staff helped us with our luggage up and down the stairs. It is not often I return to a hotel in a city - but with this one...... I have no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: jennykenny
Reviews.Content: Although we had a basement room (we booked at the last minute and there was an International Water Forum taking place) we were happy with our two single bedded room. Those of you who are still smokers might want to know that it opens out into a 'well' where you can step outside and light up (probably known by the staff but a blind eye is turned). Hotel is incredibly well placed for for the Blue Mosque etc and has an amazing view from the top floor bar/coffee shop. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: ApolloC
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed here and had an excellent visit during Ramadan. The staff were kind, attentive and extraordinarily helpful--ranging from finding us a travel agent and walking us to his office to letting me use their fax machine to finish up some work. The travel agent by the way quoted us far less than everyone else we shopped around with. This is to say, they really look after you here, not to mention it is a fantastic location with an incredible view of the Blue Mosque. The only downside was that the rooms were very small, but whatever--you're in the middle of Istanbul, what do you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Sultanahmet district of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aukahkay
Reviews.Content: The Turkoman Hotel is an old Ottoman house located just across the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. It is perfect for sightseeing. Each room is decorated in Ottoman style and has a unique name for each room. My room was called Fethiye and it overlooked the Blue Mosque. Breakfast is on the roof terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque. The staff are helpful and friendly and attended to all my needs and requests. The Turkoman is perfect for sightseeing and taking in the major sights in Sultanhamet ie. Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Grand Bazaar. The only drawback is that there is no elevator in the hotel and if you are on the third level, you have to carry your suitcase up the staircase. As the hotel faces the Blue Mosque, you will be awakened by the call to worship every morning at 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Madonnadelparto
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful four-night stay at the Hotel Turkoman. The room rates are about average for Istanbul, so we were not expecting anything above average in terms of quality or comfort. In fact, this is a fine hotel -- welcoming, plush and comfortable. We booked a corner room with two french windows. The view, straight on to the Blue Mosque, took our breath away. Just off the Hippodrome, the hotel is five minutes from some of the key sites -- Hagia Sophia, the Basiliica Cistern and the Museum of Islamic and Turkish Art, as well as the Mosque itself. Heading uphill, a ten minute walk brings you to the Grand Bazaar. On our last day, I tried the Cemberlitas hamam (near the entrance to the Grand Bazaar) and felt rested for days afterwards. The hotel has a wonderful roof terrace overlooking the mosque for breakfast and drinks. The breakfast sets you up for the day -- and the organic apricot and orange marmalade is as good as other reviews suggest! We were there during Ramadan, and the Hippodrome sprang into life at dusk as families gathered around stalls to break their fast. There was a book market within the grounds of the mosque, which was open until late at night for worshippers. We were welcomed in, even though this was technically against the rules, and had the privilege of seeing the interior free of tourists. The call to prayer at 5 am each morning shakes the area, and seems to be right in the room with you, but is still marvellous. In short -- great hotel, great staff, great room, great location. We will definitely be back. Angie Hawke and Frank Ferrie, Worthing, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Minarette
Reviews.Content: Right from the time I phoned to inquire about vacancies, till departure, a wonderful, warm place which has left me with very pleasant memories. The rooms are clean, individualistic, and comfortable. special touches of decor add to the character. the staff is helpful knoweldgeable and friendly, the proprietress charming, intelligent and helpful without being intrusive, and the breakfast is great. The view and location, unbeatable ... right across the Blue Mosque, and the terrace, together with a view of the Mosque, also has great views of the Marmara Sea. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGH_8
Reviews.Content: When my tour was cancelled, I had to book my own hotels. It was easy to deal with the staff via e-mail and the response was prompt. The Turkoman Hotel is in a convenient, quiet location, near restaurants, transportation and the Blue Mosque. The staff speaks excellent english and the room was clean and quiet. Rooftop dining for breakfast as well as an evening drink was plesant with a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic option in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Craylord
Reviews.Content: Just back from 6 days in Istanbul, ostensibly for the Grand Prix. This guesthouse far exceeded our expectations with clean rooms, excellent service and an amazing bar view over the blue mosque., Don't be put off by the website. This is a cracking place for a mid-range price bracket and I would not hesitate to stay there again on our next trip to Istanbul. In summary, top draw.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Turkoman
HotelInfo.Address: Asmali Cesme Sokak no:2 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
